### NONSTATIONARY MODELS {.text-grass-green style="font-size: 80px;"}
###  NEED MORE PARAMETERS {.text-rice-gray style="font-size: 60px; margin-left: 60px;"}

::: {.fragment .fade-in}
Generic **nonstationary model** for annual maximum precipitation:
$$
y(\mathbf{s}, t) \sim \text{GEV} \left( \mu(\mathbf{s}, t), \sigma(\mathbf{s}, t), \xi(\mathbf{s}, t) \right)
$$
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-in}
**Process-informed** models condition parameters on climate indices $\mathbf{x}(t)$ [@schlef_idf:2023;@cheng_nonstationary:2014]
$$
\theta(\mathbf{s}, t) = \alpha + \underbrace{\sum_{j=1}^J \beta_j(\mathbf{s}) x_j(t)}_\text{additional parameters}
$$
:::

---

### NONSTATIONARY MODELS {.text-grass-green style="font-size: 80px;"}
###  INCREASE ESTIMATION UNCERTAINTY {.text-rice-gray style="font-size: 60px; margin-left: 60px;"}

![](_assets/img/external/serinaldi-undead-2015-4ab.jpg){height=5.5in}

::: {style="font-size: 24px; color: #7C7E7F;"}
More parameters, same data {{< fa arrow-right-long >}} more uncertainty [@serinaldi_undead:2015]

### SPATIALLY VARYING COVARIATES {.text-grass-green style="font-size: 80px;"}
### IMPROVES INFERENCE {.text-rice-gray style="font-size: 60px; margin-left: 60px;"}

**framework:** Bayesian hierarchical model (flexible, probabilistic)

**hypothesis:** parameters are smooth

**model:** latent parameters as spatial fields (Moran basis functions)


::: {style="text-align: center;"}
![](_assets/img/results/p_quantiles_basis.png)
:::
::: {style="font-size: 24px; color: #7C7E7F;"}
Histogram showing the quantile of each observed annual maximum given the posterior predictive distribution for that location and year.
For a perfect model, this will be uniformly distributed.
:::
